related_issues.title: [ImportVerilog] Cannot compile forward decleared string type
related_issues.analysis: Related issue about string type support in MooreToCore. Different crash location (moore.variable vs getModulePortInfo). This issue is about string variables, not string ports.

related_issues.title: [MooreToCore] Support for StringType from moore to llvm dialect
related_issues.analysis: Feature request/discussion about lowering StringType. Related to string type handling but not a crash report. No mention of port-specific issues.

related_issues.title: [MooreToCore] Support for Unsized Array Type
related_issues.analysis: Tangentially related - about unsized types in MooreToCore. Not specifically about string types.

related_issues.title: [MooreToCore] Support string constants
related_issues.analysis: Closed issue about string constants support. Different from dynamic string type ports.

analysis_notes: No exact duplicate found - no issue reports crash in getModulePortInfo with string port types
#8283 is closest but covers string variables, not string ports specifically
The assertion 'dyn_cast on a non-existent value' in getModulePortInfo is not mentioned in any existing issue
#8332 discusses StringType lowering design but is a feature request, not bug report
String type as module port causing crash in port info extraction is a unique scenario
recommendation_reasoning: While #8283 and #8332 discuss string type support in MooreToCore, they don't address the specific crash scenario where string type used as module port causes assertion failure in getModulePortInfo(). This appears to be a new, unreported crash path.
